definition: -ly/structural particle: used before a verb or adjective, linking it to preceding modifying adverbial adjunct
position/location/place/seat/classifier for people (honorific)/classifier for binary bits (e.g. 十六位 16-bit or 2 bytes)/(physics) potential

sentences.english: The national leaders have approved the strategy of "promote economy cooperation around Beibu Gulf".
sentences.chinese: 廣西北部灣經濟區在泛北經濟合作中具有戰略地位。

sentences.english: Constitution is the national fundamental law, with supreme status.
sentences.chinese: 憲法是國家的根本法，具有至高無上的地位。

sentences.english: In the implementation of this cross-century strategy, ethnic issues merit special attention.
sentences.chinese: 民族問題在這項跨世紀戰略的實施中具有特殊的地位。

sentences.english: The first chapter mainly analyzes the modal words' position in the word class.
sentences.chinese: 第一章主要分析了方式詞的詞類地位。

sentences.english: Some of the women-teachers are usually proud of their position of being a Diana.
sentences.chinese: 有些女教師常常以保持獨身主義地位而自豪。

sentences.english: But that dominance is now in question.
sentences.chinese: 但現在的主導地位成了問題。

sentences.english: Arsenal goalkeeper Wojciech Szczesny is determined to hold on to his Arsenal place next season.
sentences.chinese: 什琴斯尼下定決心要在下賽季保住他的首發地位。

sentences.english: BMW still trails Audi as the top luxury car brand in China.
sentences.chinese: 在中國，寶馬依然不敵奧迪頭號豪華車品牌的地位。

sentences.english: In the memo, the Argentine side recognized China's market economy status.
sentences.chinese: 在備忘錄中，阿方正式承認中國的市場經濟地位。

sentences.english: She had seen the world and lived with great people and raised herself far beyond her original humble station.
sentences.chinese: 她見過了世面，結識了大人物，地位比從前高得多。

sentences.english: The contemporary art esteems vigorously which by US occupies the mainstream status forcefully.
sentences.chinese: 由美國極力推崇的當代藝術強行佔據主流地位。

sentences.english: The conclusion part explained the status and the trend of the Mulao Minority's Yifan festival.
sentences.chinese: 結語部分說明依飯節在仫佬族文化中的地位及走向。

sentences.english: Your behaviour is not congruous with your rank.
sentences.chinese: 你的行爲和你的社會地位不相稱。

sentences.english: The only method to change buyer's habit is inquiring the monopolization position.
sentences.chinese: 而要改變用戶的習慣的唯一方法就是獲得壟斷的地位。

sentences.english: Uncertainty of position characterizes bonds in this class.
sentences.chinese: 地位不確定是這一級債券的特徵。

sentences.english: Their position enabled them to usurp power.
sentences.chinese: 他們所處的地位使其得以篡權。

definition: ability to have one's say and be listened to/influence/clout
to be on an equal footing
to have/to own/to hold/to occupy/to possess/to account for (a high proportion etc)
one's conduct/deed/activity/accomplishment/achievement/to act as/as (in the capacity of)/qua/to view as/to look upon (sth as)/to take sth to be
to have the power to rally supporters
